message: I'll start.. NERDTree.. builtin file explorer
More a collection of plugins but well worth delving deeper into: https://github.com/carlhuda/janus
I really like MRU ( http://www.vim.org/script.php?script_id=521 ) and snipMate ( https://github.com/msanders/snipmate.vim )
I've had good times with MRU but lost it during a massive .vim changeover. Might bring it back. :)
Maybe not the best, but the most addictive one; Tabular (https://github.com/godlygeek/tabular)
pathogen (https://github.com/tpope/vim-pathogen) as it makes plugin management so much better
mrtazz, it does a good job at the approach it takes. with version control I question whether it's really necessary though.
janus seems to do pretty well at making it easy to update plugins while retaining the standard vim directory structure
@bat I especially like it with git. Plugins can be added as submodules and easily updated/removed. Prior to pathogen I always lost track of where plugins put their files if I wanted to remove one.
Though, had to comment some lines due to vim.org being f'ed up.
+1 for command-t, also check out rails.vim if you are into that, and sessionman
Pathogen. NERD Commenter. Fuzzy Finder. MatchIt. Surround.
+1 for command-t, completely changed the balance of power between bash and vim
